name: Holiday Inn Berkshires

reviews.text: The Staff at the Front Desk was very helpful with directions and follow up to check to see if I had any trouble with their directions. The pool is located in the basement and is alittle dark and dismal - also no pool towels were available. The Steeples Restaurant in the hotel was reasonable and food was about average hotel food. Overall would stay again.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn-North Adams, MA
Easter sunrise surprise at the holiday inn
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I just love road trips, so during easter weekend last year we decided to drive up rt 7 thru connecticut and mass for antiquing with no reservations anywhere. we finally hit north adams and decided to stay at the holiday inn berkshires. let me tell you, we had the best time. it was clean. and there was so much for us to do. swimming,sauna, jacuzz. had dinner at the hotel restaurant...it was awesome!! food was done in culinary style. then the biggest bonus was opening the curtains on easter morning to see the sunrise coming up over the mountains with the sillouettes of five church steeples in our view. very romantic and spiritual. we're going back this easter weekend. YIPPEE

reviews.title: Location, location, location
reviews.text: Although we visited during the off-season we found the hotel and the entire area impressively charming and reasonably priced. The hotel is right in downtown and we could easily walk to a number of terrific restaurants. It also has a sizeable fitness room with a pool, jacuzzi and even a steam room. The staff was very friendly and helpful in directing us to where we wanted to go providing us maps and lists of local restaurants. MA MoCA was right around the corner and we were just a short drive from Williamstown for the Clark Art. We got more than our money's worth with this trip. Off season in the Berkshires is great!

reviews.title: Very Satisfied
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel in August 2003. The hotel lobby was small, but neat and clean. The rooms were very spacious and clean as well. The beds were comfortable. The bathrooms were very large and clean. There was a nice pool and hot tub in the basement that we used a lot. There was also a large and modern fitness center, but we did not use it. The hotel is a one minute walk to bunch of places to eat like Burger King and Subway. We did not eat at the restaurant hotel. We found the staff to be courteous. There are not a whole lot of parking spaces and some spaces are reserved for businesses in the hotel. We parked in them anyway. We would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: Bait and Switch at the front desk
reviews.text: Standard Holiday Inn. But when we checked out, suddenly the rate we had been given at check-in had gone up $20. When we tried to get it fixed we were told the manager was unavailable. When we finally got a hold of him, he basically accused us of lying and cheating! Central Holiday Inn eventually refunded the money, but it was a hassle.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the price we paid we didn't expect luxury - and we weren't disappointed.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text: The hotel is looking extremely tired and has a definite air about it - ranging from stale cooking oil in the reception area to dusty and musty in the hallways and rooms. Our room was certainly well overdue for refurbishment.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay, nice rooms

reviews.text: On the up side the staff were all very friendly, free internet access worked well and at the price we paid (low compared to other Holiday Inns) it was pretty good value.
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.text: We stayed at the Holiday Inn while visiting Williams College. It is a short drive to the college and extremely convenient for Mass MoCa. Some areas of the hotel are a bit shabby but our particular rooms, on the second floor, had fresh carpeting and new appointments generally, including excellent king size beds. The heating/cooling system was not perfect and we had to adjust it from time to time. Showers were average, with some adjustments necessary to get the right water temperature. Soudproofing is good and traffic noise was not a problem. We received a friendly welcome at check-in and were given $20.00 per room per day in breakfast coupons that we didn't realize were included in our reasonable room rate. We chose the Holiday Inn over some more charming properties in the area because of cost and availability of wireless internet. We would stay here again, assuming we had rooms of similar quality.
reviews.title: A Good Location
Not so great
reviews.text: This hotel was ok. The location was fantastic and it was close to MOCA. The room was clean but there were some hairs in the bathtub and the furnishings were a bit worn. The lobby smelled of chlorine (from the pool) and grease from the restaurant. Walls were thin. Price was alright.

description: The Holiday Inn-Berkshires is located in the foothills of the Berkshire Mountains. The entire hotel was remodeled in Nov 2011 and is the ideal choice to explore all the Berkshire museums, theatres, historic sites and outdoor activities. The hotel features an indoor pool, hot tub, two saunas, a cardio room and a game room. Our restaurant serves breakfast and dinner daily and features a covered patio for outdoor dining during the summer months. We also have free Wi-fi throughout the building.
